business.headline: Aviation regulator suspends 2 Akasa Air officials for lapses in pilots trainingThe two senior executives of the airline have reportedly failed to ensure compliances with the civil aviation requirements, Directorate General of Civil Aviation said.
Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu revives debate on 70-hour work weekZoho CEO Sridhar Vembu weighs in on the 70-hour work week debate initiated by Infosys founder Narayana Murthy. Here's his perspective.
Will DA rise again in 2025? All you need to knowCentral government employees await a potential DA hike in January 2025, which could offer modest relief amid rising costs
Sensex, Nifty rise for 2nd straight day as auto stocks rally The S&P BSE Sensex settled 226.59 points higher at 78,690.07, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 63.20 points to end at 23,813.40.

How Manmohan Singh revitalised India's economy and global standingAs the chief architect of India's 1991 economic liberalisation, Manmohan Singh's policies helped steer India away from a severe financial crisis, positioning the country as one of the world's fastest-growing economies.
Osamu Suzuki, former Suzuki Motor Corporation chairman, dies at 94Osamu Suzuki steered Suzuki Motor's rise, from pioneering Maruti 800 in India to building a global automotive legacy.

How Indian stock market benefitted under Manmohan SinghManmohan Singh's policies, introduced during a time of economic crisis in the early 1990s, reshaped India's economy and transformed the Indian stock markets.

10 income tax changes in 2024: What you need to know for filing ITR in 2025The 2024 income tax reforms introduce revised tax slabs, higher deductions, and simplified TDS and capital gains rules, making tax filing easier and offering potential savings.

Bumper stock market debut for Mamata Machinery: Should you book profit or wait? Mamata Machinery stock market listing: A 147% premium debut for Mamata Machinery leaves investors wondering: Is this the peak, or should they hold on?

DAM Capital Advisors makes strong market debut: Is it a long-term bet?DAM Capital Advisors market listing: The listing matched market predictions, as analysts and the grey market premium (GMP) had anticipated a 40%-50% premium, driven by robust demand and positive sentiment.

Sanathan Textiles shares list at 31% premium over IPO price. Hold or sell? Sanathan Textiles stock market debut: The listing comes after the company's initial public offering (IPO) witnessed robust demand, with subscriptions exceeding 36 times the total shares on offer.

Explained: Why Mazagon Dock share price is down 50% on some trading apps todayMazagon Dock stock price: Certain trading apps may be displaying the unadjusted previous closing price, leading to the perception of a 50% fall. Adjusted for the split, Mazagon Dock shares were trading 2.13% lower on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 11:09 am.

Transrail Lighting shares list at 36% premium on Dalal Street debut Transrail Lighting share price: The shares opened at Rs 585.15 per share on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). The market debut aligns with market expectations, which was oversubscribed by 81 times.

DAM Capital Advisors makes strong debut, shares list at 39% premium DAM Capital Advisors listing: On the BSE, the shares began trading at Rs 392.90, marking a 38.83% premium compared to the issue price.

Mamata Machinery shares make bumper debut with 147% premium over IPO priceMamata Machinery listing: Shares of Mamata Machinery made a bumper debut and listed at Rs 600 per share on the NSE, a lot higher than the IPO issue price of Rs 243 per share.

Sensex, Nifty open higher as auto stocks fuel early rally; Tata Motors up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 323.12 points to 78,795.60, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 101.95 points to 23,852.15 as of 9:44 AM.

Dam Capital to Mamata Machinery: GMPs of 5 IPOs ahead of D-Street debut todayThese initial public offerings (IPOs), which opened for subscription on December 19 and closed on December 23, collectively raised over Rs 2,900 crore.

Manmohan Singh's key reforms that shaped Indian economyDr Manmohan Singh's tenure as Finance Minister in the early 1990s and later as Prime Minister from 2004 to 2014 introduced policies that continue to influence India's growth.

Gautam Adani on work-life balance: Spend at least 4 hours with familyChairperson of Adani Group, Gautam Adani, shared his take on work-life balance and said one must try to spend at least four hours with their families.

Government may consider tax relief for income of up to Rs 10.50 lakh: ReportThe move, likely to be announced in the upcoming Budget 2025 on February 1, aims to boost consumption and address concerns over rising living costs amid a slowing economy.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Manmohan Singh's final journey begins, PM Modi to attend last rites Live UpdatesThe last rites of Manmohan Singh will take place around 11.45 am. The Centre agreed to allocate space for a memorial of the former Prime Minister after a war of words broke out between the BJP and the Congress.

Centre breaks deadlock with late-night nod for Manmohan Singh's memorial The Congress's request for the cremation to be held at a separate memorial site was initially denied by the Centre, following which party leader Jairam Ramesh called it a "deliberate insult to India's first Sikh Prime Minister".

Delhi records highest single-day December rainfall in 101 yearsRain continued to lash several places in Delhi-NCR on Saturday, causing average daily temperatures to drop sharply. The IMD has issued a 'yellow' alert for the weekend, predicting more showers.

Manmohan Singh: Accidental PM, but not an accidental politicianManmohan Singh served as the Prime Minister of India for 10 years, but people still perceive that he was politically naive. That couldn't be further from the truth. Singh survived in the Congress by picking his battles well even as astute politicians fell along the way.

Amid Manmohan Singh's memorial row, Pranab Mukherjee's daughter's dig at CongressSharmistha Mukherjee criticised the party for demanding a separate memorial space for former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh while failing to convene a Working Committee meeting to condole her father's death.

Stupid, Stupid, Stupid: Furious Gavaskar slams Pant for reckless dismissalIND vs AUS: Legendary Sunil Gavaskar was furious with India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant for throwing away his wicket on Day 3 of the MCG Test match. Gavaskar called Pant stupid and said the left-hander should have walked back to the Australian dressing room instead of the Indian one.

KT Rama Rao summoned by ED in Formula-E race case on January 7A case has been filed by probe agency ED against BRS leader KT Rama Rao and two others over alleged irregularities to the tune of Rs 55 crore in hosting the Formula-E race in Hyderabad in February 2023.

Carlsen trolls Chess Federation with OOTD post after quitting championshipThe world's best chess player Magnus Carlsen quit the 2024 World Rapid and Blitz Championship after being fined by FIDE over dress code. Carlsen trolled the tournament with a cheeky post on social media after quitting.

A Pak village mourns Manmohan Singh: 'Someone from our family has died'The Gah village lies about 100 km southwest of Pakistan's capital Islamabad and was part of Jhelum district when Manmohan Singh was born.

Snowfall draws thousands to Manali, but traffic chaos dampens holiday spiritOver 30,000 people visited Manali over the past week and around 10,000 vehicles were recorded entering Manali. Authorities are expecting more 20,000 tourists in the hill station for the New Year festivities.

Delhi Police's traffic advisory ahead of Manmohan Singh's funeral, check routesDelhi Traffic Police issued traffic advisory ahead of former PM Manmohan Singh's state funeral at Nigambodh Ghat. Traffic is diverted from Raja Ram Kohli Marg, Rajghat Red Light, Signature Bridge, and Yudhister Setu due to the expected presence of many dignitaries and public.

Bengaluru founder turns cab driver at 3 am as sleepy chauffeur hands over keys. VideoSharing a video in a post on Instagram, a Bengaluru-based founder narrated the story when he ended up driving his own cab at 3am after his drowsy driver could no longer stay awake.

FC Barcelona's Dani Olmo registration plea rejected by Spanish courtBarcelona's efforts to extend Dani Olmo's registration were denied, leaving the midfielder ineligible to play after December 31. With La Liga's financial restrictions looming, the club is scrambling to find solutions before the January deadline.

Corbin Bosch's 81* gives South Africa an upper hand over Pakistan on Day 2Corbin Bosch's fearless 81 on debut turned the tide for South Africa, giving them a vital 90-run lead. Pakistan now rely on Babar Azam to rescue their innings, with Day 3 poised for a gripping contest.

Sanjay Manjrekar urges team India to get rid of VIP treatment for senior playersFormer India cricketer turned commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has urged the Indian team management to stop VIP treatment of senior players.

De Jong wants to shine at FC Barcelona: Agent brushes off Saudi linksFrenkie de Jong's agent, Ali Dursun, dismissed rumors linking the Barcelona midfielder to a Saudi Pro League transfer, reiterating his commitment to the Catalan club despite recurring injuries and limited appearances during a challenging 2024/25 season.

AUS vs IND : Jasprit Bumrah let down by his pace-bowling mates yet againStar India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah once again found no support from his other seam bowling partners on Day 2 of the fourth Test against Australia in Melbourne.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
